verses.kjv: The righteous perisheth, and no man layeth it to heart: and merciful men are taken away, none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
verses.ct: Good people die, and nobody takes it to heart. Faithful people are swept away, and no one realizes that the righteous are being removed before disaster strikes.

verses.kjv: He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each one walking in his uprightness.
verses.ct: They enter into peace; those who lived with integrity find rest on their deathbeds.

verses.kjv: But draw near hither, ye sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer and the whore.
verses.ct: But you — come here, you children of a sorceress, you offspring of the adulterer and the prostitute!

verses.kjv: Against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide mouth, and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgression, a seed of falsehood,
verses.ct: Who are you mocking? Who are you making faces at, sticking out your tongues? Aren't you children of rebellion, offspring of deception?

verses.kjv: Enflaming yourselves with idols under every green tree, slaying the children in the valleys under the clifts of the rocks?
verses.ct: You burn with lust for idols under every green tree, and you slaughter children in the valleys beneath the overhanging cliffs!

verses.kjv: Among the smooth stones of the stream is thy portion; they, they are thy lot: even to them hast thou poured a drink offering, thou hast offered a meat offering. Should I receive comfort in these?
verses.ct: The smooth stones of the streambed — those are what you've chosen; those are your portion. To them you've poured out drink offerings and presented grain offerings. Should I be satisfied with this?

verses.kjv: Upon a lofty and high mountain hast thou set thy bed: even thither wentest thou up to offer sacrifice.
verses.ct: On a tall, towering mountain you set up your bed. You climbed up there to offer sacrifices.

verses.kjv: Behind the doors also and the posts hast thou set up thy remembrance: for thou hast discovered thyself to another than me, and art gone up; thou hast enlarged thy bed, and made thee a covenant with them; thou lovedst their bed where thou sawest it.
verses.ct: Behind your doors and doorposts you placed your pagan symbols. You exposed yourself to others instead of me and climbed into bed with them. You made your bed wide and struck a deal with them — you loved sleeping with them wherever you spotted the opportunity.

verses.kjv: And thou wentest to the king with ointment, and didst increase thy perfumes, and didst send thy messengers far off, and didst debase thyself even unto hell.
verses.ct: You went to the king with olive oil and loaded yourself with perfumes. You sent your representatives to distant lands and degraded yourself all the way down to the grave.

verses.kjv: Thou art wearied in the greatness of thy way; yet saidst thou not, There is no hope: thou hast found the life of thine hand; therefore thou wast not grieved.
verses.ct: You wore yourself out with all your running around, yet you never said, 'This is hopeless.' You found enough strength to keep going, so you never gave up.

verses.kjv: And of whom hast thou been afraid or feared, that thou hast lied, and hast not remembered me, nor laid it to thy heart? have not I held my peace even of old, and thou fearest me not?
verses.ct: Who were you so worried about that you resorted to lies? You forgot about me and never gave me a thought. I stayed silent for a long time — is that why you have no reverence for me?

verses.kjv: I will declare thy righteousness, and thy works; for they shall not profit thee.
verses.ct: I will expose your so-called righteousness and everything you've done — none of it will help you.

verses.kjv: When thou criest, let thy companies deliver thee; but the wind shall carry them all away; vanity shall take them: but he that putteth his trust in me shall possess the land, and shall inherit my holy mountain;
verses.ct: When you cry out for help, let your collection of idols rescue you! But the wind will blow them all away; a mere breath will carry them off. However, whoever trusts in me will possess the land and inherit my holy mountain.

verses.kjv: And shall say, Cast ye up, cast ye up, prepare the way, take up the stumblingblock out of the way of my people.
verses.ct: And it will be said, 'Build it up! Build up the road! Clear the path! Remove every obstacle from the way of my people.'

verses.kjv: For thus saith the high and lofty One that inhabiteth eternity, whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.
verses.ct: For this is what the high and exalted One says — the One who lives forever, whose name is Holy: 'I live in the high and holy place, but I also live with those who are crushed and humble in spirit, to restore the spirit of the humble and to restore the heart of those who are broken.'

verses.kjv: For I will not contend for ever, neither will I be always wroth: for the spirit should fail before me, and the souls which I have made.
verses.ct: 'I will not accuse forever, and I will not stay angry without end, because the spirit would grow faint in my presence — the very souls that I made.'

verses.kjv: For the iniquity of his covetousness was I wroth, and smote him: I hid me, and was wroth, and he went on frowardly in the way of his heart.
verses.ct: 'I was angry because of his sinful greed, so I struck him and withdrew from him in anger. Yet he kept on stubbornly following his own path.'

verses.kjv: I have seen his ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also, and restore comforts unto him and to his mourners.
verses.ct: 'I have watched how he lives, but I will heal him. I will guide him and bring comfort back to him and to those who mourn with him.'

verses.kjv: I create the fruit of the lips; Peace, peace to him that is far off, and to him that is near, saith the LORD; and I will heal him.
verses.ct: 'I create praise on their lips: Peace, peace to those who are far away and to those who are near,' says the LORD. 'I will heal them.'

verses.kjv: But the wicked are like the troubled sea, when it cannot rest, whose waters cast up mire and dirt.
verses.ct: But wicked people are like a restless sea that cannot be still, whose waves churn up mud and filth.

verses.kjv: There is no peace, saith my God, to the wicked.
verses.ct: 'There is no peace,' says my God, 'for the wicked.'
